<description type="note">Title: The embassy to Pilate of Joseph of Arimathea.
Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.
[The Embassy to Pilate of Joseph of Arimathea]

Centurio In trewth now I knowe with ful opyn syght that goddys dere sone is naylid on tre these wundyrful tokenys Aprevyn ful ryght quod vere filius dei erat iste. Alius miles 2 The very childe of god I suppose Ã¾at he be and so it semyth wele be his wundyrful werk Ã¾e erth sore qwakyth and Ã¾at agresyth me With myst and grett wedyr it is woundyr dyrk. Alius miles 3 Soch merveylis shewe may non erthely man Ã¾e eyr is ryght derke Ã¾at fyrst was ryght clere The Erth-qwave is grett Ã¾e clowdys waxe whan those tokenys preve hym a lorde with-out Any pere. Centurio his fadyr is pereles kyng of most empere bothe lorde of Ã¾is world and kynge of hevyn hy?e ?it out of all synne to brynge us owt of daungere he soferyth his dere sone for us all to dye. Nichodemus Alas Alas what syght is this to se Ã¾e lorde and kynge of blys Ã¾at nevyr synnyd ne dede Amys Ã¾us naylid vpon a rode Alas ?ewys what haue ?e wrought A ?e wyckyd wytys what was ?our thought Why haue ?e bobbyd and Ã¾us betyn owth all his blyssyd blood. Senturyo A now trewly telle weyl I kan Ã¾at Ã¾is was goddys owyn sone I knowe he is both god and man be Ã¾is wark Ã¾at here is done. Ã¾er was nevyr man but god Ã¾at cowde make Ã¾is werk Ã¾at evyr was of woman born were he nevyr so gret A clerk it passeth hem all Ã¾ow Ã¾ei had sworn. hese lawe was trewe I dare wel saye Ã¾at he tawth us here A-monge Ã¾erfore I rede ?e turne ?our faye and amende Ã¾at ?e han do wronge. Joseph of Ara .. O good lord jhesu Ã¾at deyst now here on rode haue mercy on me and for-gyf me my mys I wold Ã¾e worchep here with my good Ã¾at I may come to Ã¾i blysse. to pylat now wole I goon and aske Ã¾e body of my lord jhesu to bery Ã¾at now wold I soon in my grave Ã¾at is so new. heyl sere pylat Ã¾at syttyth in sete heyl justyce of jewys men do Ã¾e calle heyl with helth I do Ã¾e grete I pray Ã¾e of A bone what so befalle. to bery jhesu is body I wole Ã¾e pray Ã¾at he were out of mennys syth for to-morwyn xal be oure holyday Ã¾an wole no man hym bery I Ã¾e plyth. And yf we lete hym hange Ã¾er stylle Some wolde seyn Ã¾er of A-now Ã¾e pepyl Ã¾er-of wold seyn ful ylle Ã¾at nother xuld be ?our worchep nor prow. Pylat Sere joseph of baramathie I graunt Ã¾e With jhesu is body do Ã¾in intent but fyrst I wole wete Ã¾at he ded be as it was his jugement. Sere knytys I comawnd ?ow Ã¾at ?e go in hast with josepht of baramathie and loke ?e take good hede Ã¾er-to Ã¾at jhesu suerly ded be. se Ã¾at Ã¾is comawndement ?e fulfylle with-out wordys ony mo and Ã¾an lete joseph do his wylle what Ã¾at he wyl with jhesu do. here come to knytys be-forn pylat At-onys Ã¾us seyng Sere we xal do oure dylygens with joseph goyng to Caluerye be we out of Ã¾i presens sone Ã¾e trewth we xal aspye. Joseph Ab Gramercy pylat of ?our jentylnesse Ã¾at ?e han grawntyd me my lyst Any thyng in my province ?e xal haue at ?our resquest. Pylat Sere all ?our lest ?e xal haue with jhesu is body do ?our intent whethyr ?e bery hym in pyt or grave Ã¾e powere I grawnt ?ow here present.
